Class HighScores

java.lang.Object
HighScores
public class HighScores extends Object
Class to manage high scores.

1.0
Author:
Tomasz Fijalkowski

  • Method Details

    • loadData

      public static void loadData() throws FileNotFoundException
      Load data from text file to memory. Should be use only once at the start of the program.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - file not found

    • saveDataToFile

      public static void saveDataToFile() throws IOException
      Saves data from memory to a file. Can be used many times (but it might be use only while switching the scenes). Strongly recommended using at the end of the program (otherwise changes are lost).
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getTopScores

      Gets the tops scores for a level.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      array of Score

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      array of Score

    • saveScore

      public static void saveScore(String profileName, String levelName, int score)
      Method will try to safe a score, if it is in top 10.
      Parameters:
      profileName - name of a profile
      score - achieved score you want to safe
      levelName - level of the game

    • deleteProfile

      public static void deleteProfile(String profileName)
      Delete every profile score from a database.
      Parameters:
      profileName - name of a profile

    • createNewLevel

      public static void createNewLevel(String levelName)
      Creates new level in database, with no scores.
      Parameters:
      levelName - name of new level

    • deleteLevel

      public static void deleteLevel(String levelName) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Deletes level from a database, if exists.
      Parameters:
      levelName - name of a level to delete
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • doesLevelExist

      public static boolean doesLevelExist(String levelName)
      Checks if level exist in database.
      Parameters:
      levelName - name of the level to check
      Returns:
      true if level exist, false otherwise
